title.narrative: OUTPUT 5.2: Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT), ADO AND PED HIV CARE

description.narrative: By 2020, health structures facilities and civil society are able to provide quality and equitable Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) and paediatric and adolescent HIV services in 3 regions, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 women, children and adolescent, especially the most vulnerable, use equitable and quality HIV services

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, health structures facilities and civil society are able to provide quality and equitable PMTCT and paediatric and adolescent HIV services in 3 regions

description.narrative: In 2019, the Country Office contributed to the integration of PMTCT in 99 per cent of public health centers offering maternal, newborn, and child health services. It also provided ARVs to pregnant and lactating women and paediatric ARVs in 100 per cent of health centers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/02/2020
